intro: Chamaecrista orbiculata var. trichothyrsus, commonly known as the hairy globe senna, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its globular, rounded seed pods and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are typically clustered in racemes, and it has a woody, shrub-like growth habit. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in dry, arid conditions due to its drought-resistant properties. The plant's botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and ornamental gardening.
